description: Over four years, I  participated in all aspects of product development lifecycle from planning through execution! I was responsible for developing and maintaining the front-end of each application, working closely with the design team to create seamless user experiences. Most recently, as part of the tech leadership team, I planned, developed, executed, and maintained aspects of a software development life cycle for the frontend/UX with the goal to design and develop robust, scalable, and secure solutions, ensuring high performance and user satisfaction.

Starting out as one of only two frontend engineers, I had a big part in digitizing an 80 year old federal process from 70+ printed pages into a short, dynamic, all-inclusive web-based form and user site.

As the sole in-house software engineer, I managed and led in the development of all Aeroasis software endevours including rebuilding the public website, which resulted in a 200% increase in visitor traffic and improved company SEO. I created and maintained the company shop through Shopify, paypal, and Square. I developed the Aeroasis Grow App: an IoT connected mobile user app that maintained and controled an indoor garden ecosystem. In addition, I developed an education curricula and built a web platform for teachers and educators to access and interact with our lesson plans.

I crafted impactful and engaging online presences for a variety of small businesses. I translated client needs into effective web solutions. Throughout I managed the web application projects and development from conception through launch.

I provided strategic leadership and hands-on management for the museum's community outreach programs, education initiatives and community services. I managed a team of educators, interns and volunteers.
I coordinated support services for students in a 5-12 grade public school. This included curriculum development, teacher training, and student support services. I managed a team of educators.

I helped found a small school with a focus on STEM education. I advised and taught middle and high school math, social studies, English and literacy, and art in general and special education settings.
